title: Formulas & The Balance Sheet
description: How Excel thinks about money: Inputs, Outputs, and Math.

steps.text:
# The Magic of Equals (=)

In math class, you write `2 + 2 = 4`. The equals sign comes at the *end*.

But in Excel, you are telling the cell what to *become*. So you start with the equals sign.

`= 2 + 2` tells the cell: "Hey, calculate this for me!"

steps.goalDescription: In cell A1, type a formula to add 5 and 5. (Hint: start with =)

steps.text:
### Referencing Cells

Hard-coding numbers like `=5+5` is boring. The real power comes from pointing to other cells.

If you have income in A1 and expenses in A2, your profit is `=A1 - A2`.

When A1 changes, the profit updates instantly. This is called **Recalculation**.

steps.goalDescription: Cell A1 has your Income (100). Cell A2 has your Expenses (40). In cell A3, write a formula to subtract Expenses from Income.
